name: Yallaiah Onteru
title: Data Center Fiber & Cabling Technician
professional_summary: Hands-on Data Center Fiber & Cabling Technician with several years of experience working in live data center environments supporting fiber and copper infrastructure.
Skilled in inspecting, cleaning, installing, labeling, and organizing fiber optic and CAT6 cabling while following strict customer standards and safety guidelines.
Comfortable working with pre-terminated fiber, cabling matrices, and client-defined labeling schemas.
Known for being detail-oriented, dependable, and able to work independently or alongside lead technicians and supervisors to deliver clean, well-organized cabling solutions on time.
core_skills: Client Cabling Matrix & Labeling Schema Compliance
Overhead Ladder Racks, Trays & Existing Pathways
daily_activities: Installing fiber per client cabling matrix
Dressing and securing cables for airflow and bend radius

responsibilities: Inspected and cleaned fiber optic cables using approved fiber inspection probes and cleaning kits to ensure optimal signal quality and connection reliability.
Installed pre-terminated fiber cables according to customer cabling matrices, ensuring compliance with client-specific labeling schemas and technical specifications.
Labeled fiber cables on both ends using flag labelers, maintaining accurate documentation and traceability for all installed infrastructure.
Routed cabling through overhead ladder racks and trays while maintaining proper bend radius and cable management standards for airflow optimization.
Troubleshot, tested, and re-terminated fiber patch cables (no splicing) to resolve connectivity issues and maintain network uptime in live data center environments.
Secured and dressed fiber and CAT6 cabling to ensure clean, organized installations that comply with data center aesthetic and operational standards.
Assisted lead technicians and supervisors with complex installations, learning advanced techniques and contributing to team efficiency on large-scale projects.
Followed all data center safety and quality standards including hot aisle protocols, equipment handling procedures, and customer access policies.
Supported structured cabling installations (fiber & CAT6) for data center network infrastructure projects across multiple colocation facilities.
Routed and secured cables through racks and conduits following industry best practices and client specifications for data center installations.
Conducted basic cable testing using network testing equipment to verify connectivity and signal integrity after installation.
Assisted with labeling and documentation of installed cables, maintaining accurate records for client handover and future maintenance.
Maintained organized cabling layouts in server rooms and network closets, ensuring proper cable management and accessibility for future modifications.
